channel.title: Items over 12,000
channel.description:
My server will not give a player an item, if the item's ID is over 12000. The lastest item list on the Silab client goes up to 15489, so that could be a problem...
I have looked through *all* my java files, searching for 12000, and no luck.
Any tips?

item.title: Items over 12,000
item.dc:creator: @Moptop Moptop
item.description:
@Moptop wrote:

Already had that, forgot to mention.

I found elsewhere that…

Go to item.java n change your [code] public static boolean[] itemStackable = new boolean[19999]; public static boolean[] itemIsNote = new boolean[19999]; public static boolean[] itemTwoHanded = new boolean[19999]; public static boolean[] itemTradeable = new boolean[19999]; public static boolean[] itemSellable = new boolean[19999];[/code] TO

public static boolean[] itemStackable = new boolean[20000]; public static boolean[] itemIsNote = new boolean[20000]; public static boolean[] itemTwoHanded = new boolean[20000]; public static boolean[] itemTradeable = new boolean[20000]; public static boolean[] itemSellable = new boolean[20000];

Fixed it. Thanks for the help anyways!

Read full topic

item.title: Items over 12,000
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Add this pickup code, this isn’t mine, credits don’t go to me

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 1)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); if (newItemID <= 20000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist"); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! "); } }

See if that works.

Read full topic
